results.title: Whazzat?
results.creator_credit: Art Pierson, Todd Delerman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the East Indian folktale about six blind men who come upon an elephant and attempt to describe it. When each meets and touches the elephant he thinks he has encountered something different. Stresses the moral that cooperating with others can achieve more than working alone. For primary grades.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art Pierson, Todd Delerman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Donkeys
results.brief_description: Shows the physical and behavioural characteristics of adult and young donkeys which are closely observed in this non-narrated film. Also features close-up studies of individual details, with a soundtrack of music and natural sounds. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Goats
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film in which the physical appearance and behaviour patterns of a herd of goats are studied. Individual details are featured in close-up. Aspects of goat behaviour are also shown, from the gentle grazing on leaves to the aggressive head-butting of the males. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Animals of the rocky shore
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley and Hugh Baddeley Productions
results.brief_description: This film presents creatures of the rocky shore. Close-ups of crabs are shown, revealing the complexity of the mouth parts. In deeper water mullet, pollack and bass are shown swimming. An egg-case is removed from a dogfish and the developing embryo is shown.

results.title: Bending and reflecting sunlight
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Three boys, experimenting with everyday objects, discover the phenomena of refraction and reflection. Playing with a magnifying glass, a water-filled jar, and hose spray, they begin to grasp the principles of magnification, bent images, and rainbows, as they see light interacting with various materials. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Rock pools: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Donald Walton, Anvil Films and Record Group and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description: This film is a study of plants and animals whose structure and habits enable them to live in rock pools. The close association between plants and animals is illustrated. The ecology of rock pools is related to the rise and fall of the tide, heating and cooling, desiccation and flooding. Suitable for upper primary and lowere secondary levels.

results.brief_description: An animated spoof on film credits, with an unexpected twist, starring two classic cinematic characters.

results.title: Breath death: a tragedy in masks
results.creator_credit: S. Vanderbeek and A Visible Fill'm
results.brief_description: An anti-war collage composed of fleeting black and white visual using a variety of animation techniques. The tone of this experimental film is surreal using sources of images and sounds from the 20th Century, opening with the rhythm from Screamin’ Jay Hawkins’ ‘I Put a Spell on You’. Soundtrack by Jay Watt.

results.title: Comput-her baby
results.creator_credit: Dave Goldson, Neal Chastain and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: A humorous but pointed satire on computer dating. Accompanied by ironically contrasting musical background, human voices reveal personal statistics for consumption by the computer. Compares cybernetic matching and old-fashioned computers, and questions the relationship between people and computers.

results.title: Quick rise
results.brief_description: Time lapse photography is used to speed up the action in a town and a twenty storey building goes from ground level to completion in hour minutes. Visual speed is enhanced by a lively Bach piece preformed on a Moog synthesiser.
